main.title: University of Washington, Seattle
main.organization: B.S. in Computer Engineering and B.S. in Mathematics | GPA 3.80/4.00
details: Relevant coursework: Honors Accelerated Calculus, Honors Mechanics, Honors Electromagnetism, Intermediate Data Programming, Beginner Scientific Computing
Activities and societies: Husky Satellite Lab, The Boring Club, Synaptech, Husky Tennis Club

main.title: École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne
main.organization: Summer Study Abroad in Lausanne, Switzerland

main.title: Tohoku University
main.organization: Summer Study Abroad in Sendai, Japan
details: Participated in the Tohoku University STEM Summer Program 2025 (TSSP), spending 4 weeks in Japan exploring various disciplines from Robotics for Space Exploration to Nonverbal Information to Enrich Future Telecommunications.
Awarded the Japan Student Services Organization Scholarship (JASSO) from demonstrating excellent academic and personal records at home university.

main.title: University of Washington Rome Center
main.organization: Early-Fall Study Abroad in Rome, Italy
details: Participated in the Freshmen Study Abroad Rome: Travel Writing in the Eternal City
Explored historical landmarks and cultural sites across Rome to inform reflective and analytical travel essays
Sharpened storytelling and observation skills through immersive writing workshops, peer critiques, and guided excursions

expandable.title: Hwa Chong Institution
expandable.organization: Singapore GCE A-Levels and Hwa Chong Diploma
details: Subjects offered: H3 Physics, H2 Physics, H2 Mathematics, H2 Chemistry, H2 Economics, H1 General Paper, H1 Project Work
Secretary-Treasurer of the Hwa Chong Astronomy Club (2022-2023)
Represented Hwa Chong for the Singapore Physics Olympiad and obtained Silver
Conducted research under the Centre for Science Research & Talent Development(CenTaD) where we studied the relativistic effects of cosmic muons using a self-assembled muon detector
Attended a NUS Robotics and Coding Workshop fortnightly
Served as the ICT Rep of the class

expandable.title: Nanyang Girls' High School
details: Studied the most vigorous coursework with 9 academic subjects and 2 advanced subjects
Subjects offered: Advanced Physics, Advanced Mathematics, Physics, Integrated Mathematics 1 and 2, Chemistry, Biology, Geography, Integrated Humanities, Higher Chinese and Language Arts
